did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Waldemar H. Fries Audubon research papers, 1805-1980.
did.physdesc: Correspondence, manuscripts, research material, publications, auction catalogues, exhibition catalogues, art work, books
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, manuscripts, and other materials relating to the writing and production of The Double Elephant Folio; correspondence, slides, books, notebooks,pamphlets and artwork relating to John James Audubon and his family, and other ornithologists. Also, material concerning Audubon exhibitions, including catalogues, Audubon slides, stamps, and photographs.
did.langmaterial: Collection material in English German French

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Waldemar Hans Fries graduated from Cornell University in 1911.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, and other materials relating to the writing and production of The Double Elephant Folio; correspondence, slides, books, notebooks,pamphlets and artwork relating to John James Audubon and his family, and other ornithologists. Also, material concerning Audubon exhibitions, including catalogues, Audubon slides, stamps, and photographs.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Waldemar H. Fries Audubon research papers, #3427. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIAL
relatedmaterial.p: The John James Audubon artwork, collection #6721 also contains original and reproductions of Audubon prints.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: See also Waldemar H. Fries papers, collection # 47-3-m.849.

4. Carolina Parrot
5. Yellow-billed Cuckoo

7. Whip-poor-will
8. Belted Kingfisher
9. Ivory-billed Woodpecker
10. Brown Thrasher

list.head: The following books have been removed from the collection and many are now cataloged separately. They may be found using the online library catalog.
list.item:
The AOU Check list of North American Birds, Fifth Edition by American Ornithologists Union
Published: Baltimore, Lord Baltimore Press, 1957
Notes by Fries: Named in ink, 1958

Audubon, An Intimate Life of the American Woodsman by Arthur, Stanley Clisby
Published: New Orleans, Harmanson, 1937
Notes by Fries: Notes on cover referencing page nos; Includes full color map

The Salem Anthenaeum, 1810-1910 by Ashton, Joseph Nickerson
Published: Salem, Mass, [Berkeley Press], 1917
Notes by Fries: Note referncing pg. no on cover.

Audubon Birds, from the Original Water Colors in the New York Historical Society by Audubon, John James
Published: New York, Hastings House, 1946
Notes by Fries: Notes on multiple pages, marking Audubon plate nos.

Audubon in the West; Compiled, edited, and with an introduction by Elliott Coues by Audubon, John James
Published: London, J.C. Nimmo, 1898
Notes by Fries: Includes a loose, inserted book review.

Audubon, by Himself; A profile of John James Audubon from writings selected, arranged and edited by Alice Ford. by Audubon, John James
Published: Garden City, NY, Natural History Press, 1969
